---
title: "Biology - New Temperature correction algorithm"
date: "2016-05-10"
author: "Gorton, Bec (Environment, Hobart)"
---

This is an non-compulsory change to your biology input files.

There is a new algorithm for calculating the temperature correction to apply for clearance, mortality etc.

Documentation of the temperature correction is now on the wiki at:
[Effect of temperature on functional groups](/display/Atlantis/Effect+of+temperature+on+functional+groups)

**New Parameters**

As mentioned above these are not compulsory changes to your file. If you don't specify a q10_method value for a functional group it will default to 0. The optimum temperature and correction values are only read in for grousp where the q10_method value is 0.

1. The method of calculating Q10 0 is the 'normal' way of calculating it. 1 is the 'new' climate change method from Gary G.
